intro: Neisosperma sevenetii, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, fragrant leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that give way to small, orange-colored fruits. Neisosperma sevenetii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and a slow growth rate. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
